author: Special Correspondent
text:
Conducts Shirk (Idolatory) Eradication Conference in Tiruchi

The objective of the conference was to create awareness among Muslims about un-Islamic practices, said TNTJ secretary M.S. Sulaiman. -Photo: B.Velankanni Raj

Amid protests from certain Hindu organisations and opposition from its own community outfits, the Tamil Nadu Thowheed Jamaath’s (TNTJ) ‘Shirk (Idolatory) Eradication Conference’ held here on Sunday called upon Muslims to extricate themselves from superstitious and “un-Islamic” beliefs and practices. Exhorting its community members to worship only “Allah”, the mega conclave appealed to Muslims to desist from worshipping humans – alive or those departed. Held amidst heavy police security, the mammoth gathering saw the participation of TNTJ members and a cross-section of Muslims including a sizeable percentage of women. The objective of the conference was to create awareness among Muslims to extricate themselves from superstitious beliefs and un-Islamic practices, said TNTJ secretary M.S. Sulaiman told The Hindu .

Earlier, the Akila Bharata Hindu Mahasabha staged a demonstration condemning the Shirk conference. The Hindu Makkal Katchi presented a petition to the City Police seeking a ban on the conference. A few days ago, the Sunnath Jamaath Kolgai Kootamaippu, Coimbatore district also presented a similar petition.
title: Thowheed Jamaath urges Muslims to shun superstitions
